contextId.information: Here "My" refers to Deborah. This whole statement can be translated in first person. AT: "My princes in Issachar were with me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: My princes in Issachar were with Deborah

contextId.information: The thornbush refers to itself as "the thornbush." AT: "then may fire come out from me, the thornbush" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: then let fire come out of the thornbush

contextId.information: The Levite speaks of himself and the others as servants and in the third person to show respect. AT: "me, my concubine, and my servant"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_123person]])
contextId.quote: me and your female servant here, and for this young man with your servants
